actions.committee: House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Banking, Finance and Urban Affairs.

committees.committee: House Banking, Finance, and Urban Affairs

official_title: A bill to amend section 1110(a) of the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 to permit a customer of a financial institution to challenge in district court access to financial records with payment of the same filing fee that is required for an application for a writ of habeas corpus.

summary.text: Amends the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 to require a customer of a financial institution who files a motion to quash an administrative summons or judicial subpoena or an application to enjoin a Government authority from obtaining financial records for law enforcement purposes, to pay the five dollar filing fee which is currently required on filing an application for a writ of habeas corpus.

titles.title: A bill to amend section 1110(a) of the Right to Financial Privacy Act of 1978 to permit a customer of a financial institution to challenge in district court access to financial records with payment of the same filing fee that is required for an application for a writ of habeas corpus.
